# djust

> djust is a Python/Rust framework that brings Phoenix LiveView-style reactive server-side rendering to Django. Real-time UI updates over WebSockets with ~5KB client JS, zero build step, and Rust-powered VDOM diffing + template rendering for 10-100x performance.

## Docs

- [Getting Started](https://djust.org/docs/getting-started/): Installation, setup, and your first LiveView
- [Core Concepts](https://djust.org/docs/core-concepts/): LiveView lifecycle, mount/render cycle, event handling
- [Components](https://djust.org/docs/components/): LiveComponent, stateful and stateless components
- [State Management](https://djust.org/docs/state/): Decorators (@debounce, @throttle, @cache, @optimistic, @client_state)
- [Forms](https://djust.org/docs/forms/): FormMixin, real-time validation, form handling patterns
- [Testing](https://djust.org/docs/testing/): LiveViewTestClient, SnapshotTestMixin, LiveViewSmokeTest
- [API Reference](https://djust.org/docs/api/): Full API documentation
- [Features](https://djust.org/features/): Feature overview and capabilities
- [Security](https://djust.org/security/): Security model, CSRF, authorization patterns
- [Examples](https://djust.org/examples/): Interactive code examples
- [Benchmarks](https://djust.org/benchmarks/): Performance comparisons
- [FAQ](https://djust.org/faq/): Common questions and answers

## Optional

- [Blog](https://djust.org/blog/): Framework updates and technical articles
- [Use Cases](https://djust.org/use-cases/): Real-world application patterns
- [Philosophy](https://djust.org/philosophy/): Design principles and manifesto
- [Comparison](https://djust.org/comparison/): How djust compares to HTMX, React, etc.
- [Quickstart](https://djust.org/quickstart/): 5-minute getting started guide

## AI-Optimized Reference

- [Full LLM Reference](https://djust.org/docs/llms-full.txt): Complete framework reference in one file (<4000 tokens), optimized for LLM context windows
